name: EcoReportAI
description: EcoReportAI is an agentic LLM service that automatically gathers corporate sustainability data, checks regulatory requirements, aggregates stakeholder survey results, and drafts comprehensive ESG reports for investors and auditors.

tools.name: fetch_esg_data
tools.description: Retrieves the latest ESG metrics for a given company from public APIs (e.g., Bloomberg, Refinitiv, CDP) and returns them as a JSON array.

company_id.description: Unique identifier of the company (ticker, ISIN, or internal ID).

items.description: Specific ESG metric to retrieve (e.g., carbon_intensity, board_diversity).

metrics.description: List of ESG metric keys the user wants.

date_range.description: ISO‑8601 date range for the data, e.g., "2023-01-01/2023-12-31".

tools.name: parse_document
tools.description: Extracts structured ESG information from uploaded PDFs, Word docs, or spreadsheets and returns a normalized JSON representation.

file_url.description: Publicly accessible URL of the document to parse.

doc_type.description: The format of the supplied document.

items.description: Section headings the user wants to extract (e.g., "Carbon Emissions", "Governance Policies").

sections.description: Optional list of specific sections to pull; if omitted, parse the whole document.

tools.name: aggregate_surveys
tools.description: Collects raw stakeholder survey responses from a CSV endpoint, computes summary statistics, and returns a JSON summary.

survey_csv_url.description: URL to a CSV file containing raw survey rows.

items.description: Identifier of the survey question to aggregate.

question_ids.description: List of question IDs to include in the summary.

tools.name: check_regulatory_requirements
tools.description: Looks up the latest ESG disclosure regulations for a given jurisdiction and returns a checklist of mandatory items.

reporting_standard.description: The ESG reporting framework the company follows.

tools.name: generate_report
tools.description: Composes a formatted ESG report (Markdown) from supplied data blocks, including executive summary, metric tables, narrative sections, and compliance checklists.

company_name.description: Full legal name of the company.

metric_data.description: JSON object containing all ESG metrics keyed by metric name.

survey_summary.description: JSON summary of stakeholder survey results.

regulatory_checklist.description: List of regulatory items and their fulfillment status.

narrative_sections.description: Custom narrative paragraphs supplied by the user or generated by the LLM.

examples.description: User requests a full ESG report for Acme Corp for FY 2023. The assistant fetches ESG data, parses the latest sustainability report PDF, checks EU regulations, aggregates a stakeholder survey, and finally generates a markdown report.

messages.content: You are EcoReportAI, an expert LLM that builds ESG reports by calling specialized tools. Always cite tool results and ask clarifying questions when needed.

Prepare an ESG report for Acme Corp (ticker ACME) for FY 2023. Use the latest data, pull figures from the PDF at https://example.com/acme_sustainability_2023.pdf, and include the EU Taxonomy compliance checklist.
Got it. I will gather the required pieces step by step.
{"Carbon Emissions": {"scope1": 45000, "scope2": 120000}, "Renewable Energy Use": {"percentage": 32}, "Governance Policies": {"code_of_conduct": true, "anti_bribery": true}}
All data sources have been collected. I will now compose the ESG report using the gathered information.

narrative_sections.title: Executive Summary
narrative_sections.content: Acme Corp continued its sustainability journey in FY 2023, reducing carbon intensity by 5% and increasing renewable energy use to 32% of total consumption.

narrative_sections.title: Governance Highlights
narrative_sections.content: The board now comprises 38% women and the company has fully implemented its anti‑bribery policy.

messages.content:
# Acme Corp – ESG Report (FY 2023)

## Executive Summary
Acme Corp continued its sustainability journey in FY 2023, reducing carbon intensity by 5% and increasing renewable energy use to 32% of total consumption.

## ESG Metrics
| Metric | Value |
|---|---|
| Carbon Intensity (tCO₂e/£M) | 0.42 |
| Energy Consumption (MWh) | 1,250,000 |
| Board Diversity (Women %) | 38 |
| Human Rights Incidents | 2 |
| Scope 1 Emissions (tCO₂e) | 45,000 |
| Scope 2 Emissions (tCO₂e) | 120,000 |
| Renewable Energy Share | 32% |

## Stakeholder Survey Summary
- Q1 (Sustainability Importance) – Avg 4.2/5 (350 responses)
- Q2 (Governance Confidence) – Avg 3.8/5 (340 responses)
- Q3 (Social Impact) – Avg 4.5/5 (360 responses)

## EU Taxonomy Compliance Checklist
- Climate mitigation: **Met**
- Social safeguards: **Partial**
- Governance transparency: **Met**

## Governance Highlights
Acme Corp's board now comprises 38% women and the company has fully implemented its anti‑bribery policy.

*Prepared by EcoReportAI*
The ESG report for Acme Corp (FY 2023) has been generated. Let me know if you need any sections edited or exported to PDF.
